info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 7:27AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT WEBER...CACHE...EAST CENTRAL BOX ELDER...RICH...NORTHWESTERN WASATCH...SALT LAKE...EASTERN DAVIS... MORGAN...WESTERN SUMMIT...UTAH AND SOUTHEASTERN TOOELE COUNTIES... At 725 AM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 9 miles east of Smithfield to near Salt Lake City International Airport to near Vernon...and moving east at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Provo, Sandy, Ogden, Layton, Logan, Murray, Bountiful, Payson, Farmington, Park City, Morgan, Coalville, Randolph, Laketown, Hill Air Force Base, Heber City, West Jordan and Orem. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 242 and 334, and near mile marker 342. Interstate 84 between mile markers 83 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 111 and 196. US Route 6 between mile markers 154 and 184. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 25. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 110 and 135. * strong winds in excess of 45 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this squall. * SNOWFALL RATES GREATER THAN 2 INCHES PER HOUR ARE OCCURRING IN this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
